name: Gutap
description: These are savory fried pies filled with a mixture of finely chopped herbs, spinach, and sometimes an addition of eggs or cheese, making them a popular snack or light meal.
steps: Prepare the dough by mixing flour, water, salt, and a bit of oil into a smooth, elastic dough. Let it rest.
For the filling, combine finely chopped spinach, green onions, dill, parsley, and optional cheese.
Divide the dough into small balls, roll each out thinly, place a spoonful of filling in the center, then fold and seal the edges.
Fry each pie in hot oil until golden brown on both sides.
Drain on paper towels and serve warm.
ingredients: 100 grams mixed herbs (dill, parsley, green onions), chopped
tips: Keep the rolled-out dough covered with a damp cloth to prevent it from drying out while preparing the pies.
Ensure the edges are well sealed to prevent the filling from leaking out during frying.
Serve with yogurt or a garlic sauce for dipping.
